summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In my former book, Theophilus, I wrote about all that Jesus began to do and to teach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day he was taken up to heaven, after giving instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After his suffering, he presented himself to them and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one occasion, while he was eating with them, he gave them this command: “Do not leave Jerusalem, but wait for the gift my Father promised, which you have heard me speak about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they gathered around him and asked him, “Lord, are you at this time going to restore the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them: “It is not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he said this, he was taken up before their very eyes, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were looking intently up into the sky as he was going, when suddenly two men dressed in white stood beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men of Galilee,” they said, “why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the apostles returned to Jerusalem from the hill called the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day’s walk from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived, they went upstairs to the room where they were staying. Those present were Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew; James son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all joined together constantly in prayer, along with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Peter stood up among the believers (a group numbering about a hundred and twenty)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Brothers and sisters, the Scripture had to be fulfilled in which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was one of our number and shared in our ministry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (With the payment he received for his wickedness, Judas bought a field; there he fell headlong, his body burst open and all his intestines spilled out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone in Jerusalem heard about this, so they called that field in their language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For,” said Peter, “it is written in the Book of Psalms:
“‘May his place be deserted;
    let there be no one to dwell in it,’
and,
“‘May another take his place of leadership.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is necessary to choose one of the men who have been with us the whole time the Lord Jesus was living among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning from John’s baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they nominated two men: Joseph called Barsabbas (also known as Justus) and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they prayed, “Lord, you know everyone’s heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to take over this apostolic ministry, which Judas left to go where he belongs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cast lots, and the lot fell to Matthias; so he was added to the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the day of Pentecost came, they were all together in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly a sound like the blowing of a violent wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit enabled them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were staying in Jerusalem God-fearing Jews from every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this sound, a crowd came together in bewilderment, because each one heard their own language being spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Utterly amazed, they asked: “Aren’t all these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then how is it that each of us hears them in our native language?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, Medes and Elamites; residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene; visitors from Rome
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (both Jews and converts to Judaism); Cretans and Arabs—we hear them declaring the wonders of God in our own tongues!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amazed and perplexed, they asked one another, “What does this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some, however, made fun of them and said, “They have had too much wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice and addressed the crowd: “Fellow Jews and all of you who live in Jerusalem, let me explain this to you; listen carefully to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people are not drunk, as you suppose. It’s only nine in the morning!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘In the last days, God says,
    I will pour out my Spirit on all people.
Your sons and daughters will prophesy,
    your young men will see visions,
    your old men will dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even on my servants, both men and women,
    I will pour out my Spirit in those days,
    and they will prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will show wonders in the heavens above
    and signs on the earth below,
    blood and fire and billows of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will be turned to darkness
    and the moon to blood
    before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And everyone who calls
    on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fellow Israelites, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders and signs, which God did among you through him, as you yourselves know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man was handed over to you by God’s deliberate plan and foreknowledge; and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David said about him:
“‘I saw the Lord always before me.
    Because he is at my right hand,
    I will not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices;
    my body also will rest in hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead,
    you will not let your holy one see decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made known to me the paths of life;
    you will fill me with joy in your presence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fellow Israelites, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and his tomb is here to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him on oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing what was to come, he spoke of the resurrection of the Messiah, that he was not abandoned to the realm of the dead, nor did his body see decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has raised this Jesus to life, and we are all witnesses of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David did not ascend to heaven, and yet he said,
“‘The Lord said to my Lord:
    “Sit at my right hand
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I make your enemies
    a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore let all Israel be assured of this: God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off—for all whom the Lord our God will call.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other words he warned them; and he pleaded with them, “Save yourselves from this corrupt generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devoted themselves to the apostles’ teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was filled with awe at the many wonders and signs performed by the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers were together and had everything in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sold property and possessions to give to anyone who had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day they continued to meet together in the temple courts. They broke bread in their homes and ate together with glad and sincere hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Peter and John were going up to the temple at the time of prayer—at three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man who was lame from birth was being carried to the temple gate called Beautiful, where he was put every day to beg from those going into the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Peter and John about to enter, he asked them for money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter looked straight at him, as did John. Then Peter said, “Look at us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man gave them his attention, expecting to get something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Silver or gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking him by the right hand, he helped him up, and instantly the man’s feet and ankles became strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people saw him walking and praising God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they recognized him as the same man who used to sit begging at the temple gate called Beautiful, and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the man held on to Peter and John, all the people were astonished and came running to them in the place called Solomon’s Colonnade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter saw this, he said to them: “Fellow Israelites, why does this surprise you? Why do you stare at us as if by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus. You handed him over to be killed, and you disowned him before Pilate, though he had decided to let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked that a murderer be released to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You killed the author of life, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses of this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith in the name of Jesus, this man whom you see and know was made strong. It is Jesus’ name and the faith that comes through him that has completely healed him, as you can all see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, fellow Israelites, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did your leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is how God fulfilled what he had foretold through all the prophets, saying that his Messiah would suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he may send the Messiah, who has been appointed for you—even Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore everything, as he promised long ago through his holy prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people; you must listen to everything he tells you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does not listen to him will be completely cut off from their people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Indeed, beginning with Samuel, all the prophets who have spoken have foretold these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are heirs of the prophets and of the covenant God made with your fathers. He said to Abraham, ‘Through your offspring all peoples on earth will be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When God raised up his servant, he sent him first to you to bless you by turning each of you from your wicked ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the captain of the temple guard and the Sadducees came up to Peter and John while they were speaking to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were greatly disturbed because the apostles were teaching the people, proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They seized Peter and John and, because it was evening, they put them in jail until the next day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who heard the message believed; so the number of men who believed grew to about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the rulers, the elders and the teachers of the law met in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Annas the high priest was there, and so were Caiaphas, John, Alexander and others of the high priest’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had Peter and John brought before them and began to question them: “By what power or what name did you do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them: “Rulers and elders of the people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are being called to account today for an act of kindness shown to a man who was lame and are being asked how he was healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then know this, you and all the people of Israel: It is by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised from the dead, that this man stands before you healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus is
“‘the stone you builders rejected,
    which has become the cornerstone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the courage of Peter and John and realized that they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they took note that these men had been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since they could see the man who had been healed standing there with them, there was nothing they could say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they ordered them to withdraw from the Sanhedrin and then conferred together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What are we going to do with these men?” they asked. “Everyone living in Jerusalem knows they have performed a notable sign, and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to stop this thing from spreading any further among the people, we must warn them to speak no longer to anyone in this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John replied, “Which is right in God’s eyes: to listen to you, or to him? You be the judges!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After further threats they let them go. They could not decide how to punish them, because all the people were praising God for what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the man who was miraculously healed was over forty years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their release, Peter and John went back to their own people and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they raised their voices together in prayer to God. “Sovereign Lord,” they said, “you made the heavens and the earth and the sea, and everything in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of your servant, our father David:
“‘Why do the nations rage
    and the peoples plot in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth rise up
    and the rulers band together
against the Lord
    and against his anointed one.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed Herod and Pontius Pilate met together with the Gentiles and the people of Israel in this city to conspire against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did what your power and will had decided beforehand should happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Lord, consider their threats and enable your servants to speak your word with great boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stretch out your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the believers were one in heart and mind. No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared everything they had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With great power the apostles continued to testify to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And God’s grace was so powerfully at work in them all
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that there were no needy persons among them. For from time to time those who owned land or houses sold them, brought the money from the sales
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put it at the apostles’ feet, and it was distributed to anyone who had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means “son of encouragement”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With his wife’s full knowledge he kept back part of the money for himself, but brought the rest and put it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Ananias, how is it that Satan has so filled your heart that you have lied to the Holy Spirit and have kept for yourself some of the money you received for the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t it belong to you before it was sold? And after it was sold, wasn’t the money at your disposal? What made you think of doing such a thing? You have not lied just to human beings but to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Ananias heard this, he fell down and died. And great fear seized all who heard what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some young men came forward, wrapped up his body, and carried him out and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About three hours later his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Peter asked her, “Tell me, is this the price you and Ananias got for the land?”
“Yes,” she said, “that is the price.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to her, “How could you conspire to test the Spirit of the Lord? Listen! The feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment she fell down at his feet and died. Then the young men came in and, finding her dead, carried her out and buried her beside her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Great fear seized the whole church and all who heard about these events.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people. And all the believers used to meet together in Solomon’s Colonnade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one else dared join them, even though they were highly regarded by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, more and more men and women believed in the Lord and were added to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and mats so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds gathered also from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing their sick and those tormented by impure spirits, and all of them were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest and all his associates, who were members of the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, stand in the temple courts,” he said, “and tell the people all about this new life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At daybreak they entered the temple courts, as they had been told, and began to teach the people.
When the high priest and his associates arrived, they called together the Sanhedrin—the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they went back and reported,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We found the jail securely locked, with the guards standing at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On hearing this report, the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests were at a loss, wondering what this might lead to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then someone came and said, “Look! The men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that, the captain went with his officers and brought the apostles. They did not use force, because they feared that the people would stone them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles were brought in and made to appear before the Sanhedrin to be questioned by the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name,” he said. “Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us guilty of this man’s blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and the other apostles replied: “We must obey God rather than human beings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our ancestors raised Jesus from the dead—whom you killed by hanging him on a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God exalted him to his own right hand as Prince and Savior that he might bring Israel to repentance and forgive their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were furious and wanted to put them to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he addressed the Sanhedrin: “Men of Israel, consider carefully what you intend to do to these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time ago Theudas appeared, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men rallied to him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and led a band of people in revolt. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, in the present case I advise you: Leave these men alone! Let them go! For if their purpose or activity is of human origin, it will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop these men; you will only find yourselves fighting against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His speech persuaded them. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing because they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day after day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days when the number of disciples was increasing, the Hellenistic Jews among them complained against the Hebraic Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Twelve gathered all the disciples together and said, “It would not be right for us to neglect the ministry of the word of God in order to wait on tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers and sisters, choose seven men from among you who are known to be full of the Spirit and wisdom. We will turn this responsibility over to them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will give our attention to prayer and the ministry of the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit; also Philip, Procorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They presented these men to the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of God spread. The number of disciples in Jerusalem increased rapidly, and a large number of priests became obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Stephen, a man full of God’s grace and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Opposition arose, however, from members of the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called)—Jews of Cyrene and Alexandria as well as the provinces of Cilicia and Asia—who began to argue with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not stand up against the wisdom the Spirit gave him as he spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they secretly persuaded some men to say, “We have heard Stephen speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stirred up the people and the elders and the teachers of the law. They seized Stephen and brought him before the Sanhedrin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They produced false witnesses, who testified, “This fellow never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs Moses handed down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who were sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest asked Stephen, “Are these charges true?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this he replied: “Brothers and fathers, listen to me! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Harran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Leave your country and your people,’ God said, ‘and go to the land I will show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Harran. After the death of his father, God sent him to this land where you are now living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him no inheritance here, not even enough ground to set his foot on. But God promised him that he and his descendants after him would possess the land, even though at that time Abraham had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God spoke to him in this way: ‘For four hundred years your descendants will be strangers in a country not their own, and they will be enslaved and mistreated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will punish the nation they serve as slaves,’ God said, ‘and afterward they will come out of that country and worship me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision. And Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him eight days after his birth. Later Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because the patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, they sold him as a slave into Egypt. But God was with him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rescued him from all his troubles. He gave Joseph wisdom and enabled him to gain the goodwill of Pharaoh king of Egypt. So Pharaoh made him ruler over Egypt and all his palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then a famine struck all Egypt and Canaan, bringing great suffering, and our ancestors could not find food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our forefathers on their first visit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On their second visit, Joseph told his brothers who he was, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joseph sent for his father Jacob and his whole family, seventy-five in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our ancestors died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bodies were brought back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a certain sum of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As the time drew near for God to fulfill his promise to Abraham, the number of our people in Egypt had greatly increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then ‘a new king, to whom Joseph meant nothing, came to power in Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He dealt treacherously with our people and oppressed our ancestors by forcing them to throw out their newborn babies so that they would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time Moses was born, and he was no ordinary child. For three months he was cared for by his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was placed outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him and brought him up as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his own people, the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw one of them being mistreated by an Egyptian, so he went to his defense and avenged him by killing the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses thought that his own people would realize that God was using him to rescue them, but they did not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day Moses came upon two Israelites who were fighting. He tried to reconcile them by saying, ‘Men, you are brothers; why do you want to hurt each other?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the man who was mistreating the other pushed Moses aside and said, ‘Who made you ruler and judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you thinking of killing me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses heard this, he fled to Midian, where he settled as a foreigner and had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to Moses in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw this, he was amazed at the sight. As he went over to get a closer look, he heard the Lord say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.’ Moses trembled with fear and did not dare to look.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have indeed seen the oppression of my people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to set them free. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the same Moses they had rejected with the words, ‘Who made you ruler and judge?’ He was sent to be their ruler and deliverer by God himself, through the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led them out of Egypt and performed wonders and signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea and for forty years in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the Moses who told the Israelites, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your own people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our ancestors; and he received living words to pass on to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But our ancestors refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told Aaron, ‘Make us gods who will go before us. As for this fellow Moses who led us out of Egypt—we don’t know what has happened to him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That was the time they made an idol in the form of a calf. They brought sacrifices to it and reveled in what their own hands had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God turned away from them and gave them over to the worship of the sun, moon and stars. This agrees with what is written in the book of the prophets:
“‘Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings
    forty years in the wilderness, people of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have taken up the tabernacle of Molek
    and the star of your god Rephan,
    the idols you made to worship.
Therefore I will send you into exile’ beyond Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our ancestors had the tabernacle of the covenant law with them in the wilderness. It had been made as God directed Moses, according to the pattern he had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After receiving the tabernacle, our ancestors under Joshua brought it with them when they took the land from the nations God drove out before them. It remained in the land until the time of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who enjoyed God’s favor and asked that he might provide a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Heaven is my throne,
    and the earth is my footstool.
What kind of house will you build for me?
says the Lord.
    Or where will my resting place be?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not my hand made all these things?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You stiff-necked people! Your hearts and ears are still uncircumcised. You are just like your ancestors: You always resist the Holy Spirit!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was there ever a prophet your ancestors did not persecute? They even killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you who have received the law that was given through angels but have not obeyed it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the members of the Sanhedrin heard this, they were furious and gnashed their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked up to heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look,” he said, “I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this they covered their ears and, yelling at the top of their voices, they all rushed at him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. Meanwhile, the witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were stoning him, Stephen prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he fell on his knees and cried out, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” When he had said this, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Saul approved of their killing him.
On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Godly men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul began to destroy the church. Going from house to house, he dragged off both men and women and put them in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had been scattered preached the word wherever they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard Philip and saw the signs he performed, they all paid close attention to what he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For with shrieks, impure spirits came out of many, and many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was great joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now for some time a man named Simon had practiced sorcery in the city and amazed all the people of Samaria. He boasted that he was someone great,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the people, both high and low, gave him their attention and exclaimed, “This man is rightly called the Great Power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They followed him because he had amazed them for a long time with his sorcery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they believed Philip as he proclaimed the good news of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon himself believed and was baptized. And he followed Philip everywhere, astonished by the great signs and miracles he saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived, they prayed for the new believers there that they might receive the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Holy Spirit had not yet come on any of them; they had simply been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given at the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Give me also this ability so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter answered: “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have no part or share in this ministry, because your heart is not right before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repent of this wickedness and pray to the Lord in the hope that he may forgive you for having such a thought in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had further proclaimed the word of the Lord and testified about Jesus, Peter and John returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many Samaritan villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Go south to the road—the desert road—that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he started out, and on his way he met an Ethiopian eunuch, an important official in charge of all the treasury of the Kandake (which means “queen of the Ethiopians”). This man had gone to Jerusalem to worship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on his way home was sitting in his chariot reading the Book of Isaiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told Philip, “Go to that chariot and stay near it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip ran up to the chariot and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. “Do you understand what you are reading?” Philip asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can I,” he said, “unless someone explains it to me?” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the passage of Scripture the eunuch was reading:
“He was led like a sheep to the slaughter,
    and as a lamb before its shearer is silent,
    so he did not open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his humiliation he was deprived of justice.
    Who can speak of his descendants?
    For his life was taken from the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they traveled along the road, they came to some water and the eunuch said, “Look, here is water. What can stand in the way of my being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip, however, appeared at Azotus and traveled about, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he reached Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the Lord’s disciples. He went to the high priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any there who belonged to the Way, whether men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he neared Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who are you, Lord?” Saul asked.
“I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,” he replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men traveling with Saul stood there speechless; they heard the sound but did not see anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul got up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes he could see nothing. So they led him by the hand into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three days he was blind, and did not eat or drink anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord called to him in a vision, “Ananias!”
“Yes, Lord,” he answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told him, “Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord,” Ananias answered, “I have heard many reports about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has come here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Ananias, “Go! This man is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles and their kings and to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will show him how much he must suffer for my name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ananias went to the house and entered it. Placing his hands on Saul, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord—Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here—has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and he could see again. He got up and was baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and after taking some food, he regained his strength.
Saul spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who heard him were astonished and asked, “Isn’t he the man who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days had gone by, there was a conspiracy among the Jews to kill him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Saul learned of their plan. Day and night they kept close watch on the city gates in order to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he really was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He talked and debated with the Hellenistic Jews, but they tried to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the believers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter traveled about the country, he went to visit the Lord’s people who lived in Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he found a man named Aeneas, who was paralyzed and had been bedridden for eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aeneas,” Peter said to him, “Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your mat.” Immediately Aeneas got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (in Greek her name is Dorcas); she was always doing good and helping the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About that time she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lydda was near Joppa; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him and urged him, “Please come at once!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter went with them, and when he arrived he was taken upstairs to the room. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter sent them all out of the room; then he got down on his knees and prayed. Turning toward the dead woman, he said, “Tabitha, get up.” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took her by the hand and helped her to her feet. Then he called for the believers, especially the widows, and presented her to them alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was known as the Italian Regiment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He and all his family were devout and God-fearing; he gave generously to those in need and prayed to God regularly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day at about three in the afternoon he had a vision. He distinctly saw an angel of God, who came to him and said, “Cornelius!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cornelius stared at him in fear. “What is it, Lord?” he asked.
The angel answered, “Your prayers and gifts to the poor have come up as a memorial offering before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now send men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon who is called Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier who was one of his attendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them everything that had happened and sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About noon the following day as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He became hungry and wanted something to eat, and while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw heaven opened and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals, as well as reptiles and birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice told him, “Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely not, Lord!” Peter replied. “I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice spoke to him a second time, “Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times, and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was wondering about the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon’s house was and stopped at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called out, asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still thinking about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Simon, three men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So get up and go downstairs. Do not hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter went down and said to the men, “I’m the one you’re looking for. Why have you come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men replied, “We have come from Cornelius the centurion. He is a righteous and God-fearing man, who is respected by all the Jewish people. A holy angel told him to ask you to come to his house so that he could hear what you have to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Peter invited the men into the house to be his guests.
The next day Peter started out with them, and some of the believers from Joppa went along.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day he arrived in Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet in reverence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter made him get up. “Stand up,” he said, “I am only a man myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While talking with him, Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them: “You are well aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile. But God has shown me that I should not call anyone impure or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when I was sent for, I came without raising any objection. May I ask why you sent for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cornelius answered: “Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter began to speak: “I now realize how true it is that God does not show favoritism
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know what has happened throughout the province of Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power, and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil, because God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a cross,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen—by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all who heard the message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God.
Then Peter said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely no one can stand in the way of their being baptized with water. They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles and the believers throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers criticized him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You went into the house of uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Starting from the beginning, Peter told them the whole story:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision. I saw something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to where I was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles and birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I heard a voice telling me, ‘Get up, Peter. Kill and eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I replied, ‘Surely not, Lord! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The voice spoke from heaven a second time, ‘Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened three times, and then it was all pulled up to heaven again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Right then three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit told me to have no hesitation about going with them. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told us how he had seen an angel appear in his house and say, ‘Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring you a message through which you and all your household will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came on them as he had come on us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I remembered what the Lord had said: ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if God gave them the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to think that I could stand in God’s way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they had no further objections and praised God, saying, “So then, even to Gentiles God has granted repentance that leads to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had been scattered by the persecution that broke out when Stephen was killed traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus and Antioch, spreading the word only among Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them, however, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also, telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s hand was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News of this reached the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived and saw what the grace of God had done, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were called Christians first at Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world. (This happened during the reign of Claudius.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples, as each one was able, decided to provide help for the brothers and sisters living in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This they did, sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was about this time that King Herod arrested some who belonged to the church, intending to persecute them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw that this met with approval among the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After arresting him, he put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was earnestly praying to God for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and sentries stood guard at the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up. “Quick, get up!” he said, and the chains fell off Peter’s wrists.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel said to him, “Put on your clothes and sandals.” And Peter did so. “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me,” the angel told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed him out of the prison, but he had no idea that what the angel was doing was really happening; he thought he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city. It opened for them by itself, and they went through it. When they had walked the length of one street, suddenly the angel left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I know without a doubt that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from Herod’s clutches and from everything the Jewish people were hoping would happen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this had dawned on him, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered and were praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter knocked at the outer entrance, and a servant named Rhoda came to answer the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed she ran back without opening it and exclaimed, “Peter is at the door!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You’re out of your mind,” they told her. When she kept insisting that it was so, they said, “It must be his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter motioned with his hand for them to be quiet and described how the Lord had brought him out of prison. “Tell James and the other brothers and sisters about this,” he said, and then he left for another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After Herod had a thorough search made for him and did not find him, he cross-examined the guards and ordered that they be executed.
Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had been quarreling with the people of Tyre and Sidon; they now joined together and sought an audience with him. After securing the support of Blastus, a trusted personal servant of the king, they asked for peace, because they depended on the king’s country for their food supply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the appointed day Herod, wearing his royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shouted, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of God continued to spread and flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Barnabas and Saul had finished their mission, they returned from Jerusalem, taking with them John, also called Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch) and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after they had fasted and prayed, they placed their hands on them and sent them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two of them, sent on their way by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. John was with them as their helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled through the whole island until they came to Paphos. There they met a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, an intelligent man, sent for Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked straight at Elymas and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are a child of the devil and an enemy of everything that is right! You are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery. Will you never stop perverting the right ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the hand of the Lord is against you. You are going to be blind for a time, not even able to see the light of the sun.”
Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was amazed at the teaching about the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Paphos, Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Perga they went on to Pisidian Antioch. On the Sabbath they entered the synagogue and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the leaders of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have a word of exhortation for the people, please speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing up, Paul motioned with his hand and said: “Fellow Israelites and you Gentiles who worship God, listen to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of the people of Israel chose our ancestors; he made the people prosper during their stay in Egypt; with mighty power he led them out of that country;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for about forty years he endured their conduct in the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he overthrew seven nations in Canaan, giving their land to his people as their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All this took about 450 years.
“After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people asked for a king, and he gave them Saul son of Kish, of the tribe of Benjamin, who ruled forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After removing Saul, he made David their king. God testified concerning him: ‘I have found David son of Jesse, a man after my own heart; he will do everything I want him to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From this man’s descendants God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as he promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the coming of Jesus, John preached repentance and baptism to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As John was completing his work, he said: ‘Who do you suppose I am? I am not the one you are looking for. But there is one coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fellow children of Abraham and you God-fearing Gentiles, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though they found no proper ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had carried out all that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for many days he was seen by those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now his witnesses to our people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We tell you the good news: What God promised our ancestors
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God raised him from the dead so that he will never be subject to decay. As God has said,
“‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So it is also stated elsewhere:
“‘You will not let your holy one see decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when David had served God’s purpose in his own generation, he fell asleep; he was buried with his ancestors and his body decayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, my friends, I want you to know that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through him everyone who believes is set free from every sin, a justification you were not able to obtain under the law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care that what the prophets have said does not happen to you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Look, you scoffers,
    wonder and perish,
for I am going to do something in your days
    that you would never believe,
    even if someone told you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people invited them to speak further about these things on the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the congregation was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who talked with them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy. They began to contradict what Paul was saying and heaped abuse on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly: “We had to speak the word of God to you first. Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we now turn to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord has commanded us:
“‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles,
    that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and honored the word of the Lord; and all who were appointed for eternal life believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord spread through the whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jewish leaders incited the God-fearing women of high standing and the leading men of the city. They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them from their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shook the dust off their feet as a warning to them and went to Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At Iconium Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue. There they spoke so effectively that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the other Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews, others with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a plot afoot among both Gentiles and Jews, together with their leaders, to mistreat them and stone them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding country,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where they continued to preach the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Lystra there sat a man who was lame. He had been that way from birth and had never walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He listened to Paul as he was speaking. Paul looked directly at him, saw that he had faith to be healed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and called out, “Stand up on your feet!” At that, the man jumped up and began to walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in human form!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes because he was the chief speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates because he and the crowd wanted to offer sacrifices to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of this, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, shouting:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Friends, why are you doing this? We too are only human, like you. We are bringing you good news, telling you to turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them.
